title: agentF
author: agentF
content: Hey all!So I'm the founder of PNNV.com - you can read all about it in the original thread. Since PREEV was a simple BTC converter, my idea is to create cool features that people could also use as an alternative for CoinMarketCap and CoinGecko.So I have made a few significant updates. - You can now search any token as long as it listed on CoinMarketCap or CoinGecko.- You can see the price on the TAB.As I'm running the project from my pocket and only spending and not making any money, I would need help from the community in bug searching and UI improvements.Thank you if you could take a minute to review my website.

comments.author: 100bitcoin
comments.body: Fantastic. You are becoming what Preev.com would have been if it were born in the era of Alts. Good job. I appreciate what you are doing. All the best.

comments.author: agentF
comments.body: Quote from: 100bitcoin on September 18, 2022, 07:31:55 PMFantastic. You are becoming what Preev.com would have been if it were born in the era of Alts. Good job. I appreciate what you are doing. All the best. Thank you sir!

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: agentF on September 18, 2022, 07:20:01 PMSo I have made a few significant updates. - You can now search any token as long as it listed on CoinMarketCap or CoinGecko.- You can see the price on the TAB.It was good idea for adding price in browser tab, but I am not so much interested in bunch of other altcoins and this could be just a waste of resources in my opinion, but other people may like this more than me.Maybe you could disable other units used for bitcoin (m, k, etc.) that can be seed even when adding any other altcoins to search, and improve search because I am getting bunch of altcoins whrn I type term BTC after I selected some altcoin:

comments.author: snipie
comments.body: Good job. I really appreciated the modifications that were done and the dedication you are showing for this project, in addition to listening to our requests in the other topic.I know I have always something to say but I am curious to know why the list of fiat is not complete? I am aware there is almost all major fiat and known ones in there but I assume other people want to see their national currency there for conversion.The other remark is about how pertinent / accurate "Bitcoin to US Dollar", in top, is?I mean "BTC/CRYPTO - FIAT converter" or "Cryptocurrencies converter" or something like that will be more general and more accurate.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: New features are undoubtedly great, but seriously I hope you don't overdo it. The main reason I personally used Preev back then is because of it's simplicity. Adding too much unnecessary clutter will totally defeat the one of the main reasons why people use it.

comments.author: CoinEraser
comments.body: I tested it and looked for a few coins. As long as i write the full name of the coin, i find it. But if I search for it by shortcut, I can't find anything. It would be good if I could also find a coin in which you just enter its shortcut, such as btx, hbn, ethw etc. Otherwise, I like your site.

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: agentF on September 18, 2022, 07:20:01 PMIt's nice to see new features (and this is an interesting advertising for your page), still, imho some points are missing (or not great for me)* my home currency (RON) is not in the list* I'm not very fond of CMC/Coingecko as price source (is it that they don't update as often as preev used to?)Quote from: dkbit98 on September 18, 2022, 08:52:44 PMIt was good idea for adding price in browser tab, but I am not so much interested in bunch of other altcoins and this could be just a waste of resources in my opinion, but other people may like this more than me.Maybe you could disable other units used for bitcoin (m, k, etc.) that can be seed even when adding any other altcoins to search, and improve search because I am getting bunch of altcoins whrn I type term BTC after I selected some altcoinHeh, same has happened to me and I concluded that one has to type the coin name, not its ticker in order to get somewhat more useful result.

comments.author: agentF
comments.body: Quote from: CoinEraser on September 19, 2022, 09:55:10 AMI tested it and looked for a few coins. As long as i write the full name of the coin, i find it. But if I search for it by shortcut, I can't find anything. It would be good if I could also find a coin in which you just enter its shortcut, such as btx, hbn, ethw etc. Otherwise, I like your site.  This bug would be fixed soon! adding a "token ticker" for example RUNE / XMR. noted.Quote from: NeuroticFish on September 19, 2022, 10:15:38 AMQuote from: agentF on September 18, 2022, 07:20:01 PMIt's nice to see new features (and this is an interesting advertising for your page), still, imho some points are missing (or not great for me)* my home currency (RON) is not in the list* I'm not very fond of CMC/Coingecko as price source (is it that they don't update as often as preev used to?)Quote from: dkbit98 on September 18, 2022, 08:52:44 PMIt was good idea for adding price in browser tab, but I am not so much interested in bunch of other altcoins and this could be just a waste of resources in my opinion, but other people may like this more than me.Maybe you could disable other units used for bitcoin (m, k, etc.) that can be seed even when adding any other altcoins to search, and improve search because I am getting bunch of altcoins whrn I type term BTC after I selected some altcoinHeh, same has happened to me and I concluded that one has to type the coin name, not its ticker in order to get somewhat more useful result.I will push RON for the next update along with the TICKER update.

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: Op, are you planning to add more features? if so, perhaps a middle ground could be reached for those who want it to be as simple as possible? I was thinking you could make the extra features something people have to opt in by making 2 modes: compact and advanced.Linking your ANN thread is also a good idea for the non-forum members (yet) as they may be able to contribute as well.

comments.author: agentF
comments.body: Quote from: ETFbitcoin on September 19, 2022, 11:37:48 AMI did quick visit and found this bug. I choose "Dogecoin      doge", but the website shows pegged DOGE instead. There's also small typo where "Martket Cap" supposed to be "Market Cap".Noted, will be fixed in the next updated.Quote from: Potato Chips on September 19, 2022, 12:56:19 PMOp, are you planning to add more features? if so, perhaps a middle ground could be reached for those who want it to be as simple as possible? I was thinking you could make the extra features something people have to opt in by making 2 modes: compact and advanced.Linking your ANN thread is also a good idea for the non-forum members (yet) as they may be able to contribute as well.Im not planning to add much features but i like this idea you made.

comments.author: Little Mouse
comments.body: I used to love preev.com because of its simplicity and its very much limited list of coins. Preev was somewhat a different site. You started as preev alternative and now turned into coinmarketcap alternative (though there are differences). Personally I would appreciate a same site as of preev.Anyway, good luck with the development.

comments.author: Anonylz
comments.body: Looks simple and nice and the modification makes it better. Your user base should not be limited to only btc users which is why I don't see anything wrong with alts inclusion.  As already pointed out above, searching with coin/token ticker doesn't bring the result except typed in full. Some of the alts don't show the right max supply as shown in the image below, checked 3 different alts that come out with different max supply from CG.

comments.author: LTU_btc
comments.body: Personally I only need Bitcoin and few main altcoins, but people need for something more will appreciate this feature. I have tested it for several coins and it worked well. Everything is clear with Ethereum and BNB, but why exactly Solana is shown on the top? Just curious.And don't you consider to monetize website? Personally I wouldn't mind to see one or tow banners which cover at least some expenses.

comments.author: khaled0111
comments.body: I like the updates you introduced so far but, please, keep it as simple as possible.Here is what I noticed while browsing the website:  - When clicking on the logo/PNNV button on the top left, I was expecting to get redirected to the main page where the Bitcoin price is shown by default, but nothing happened!  - When typing a long text in one of the text fields, they keep expanding which kinda breaks the website layout.  - The coin price doesn't update automatically. When I refresh the page, it gets updated.

comments.author: agentF
comments.body: Quote from: dkbit98 on September 18, 2022, 08:52:44 PMQuote from: agentF on September 18, 2022, 07:20:01 PMSo I have made a few significant updates. - You can now search any token as long as it listed on CoinMarketCap or CoinGecko.- You can see the price on the TAB.It was good idea for adding price in browser tab, but I am not so much interested in bunch of other altcoins and this could be just a waste of resources in my opinion, but other people may like this more than me.Maybe you could disable other units used for bitcoin (m, k, etc.) that can be seed even when adding any other altcoins to search, and improve search because I am getting bunch of altcoins whrn I type term BTC after I selected some altcoin: FIXED.Quote from: Anonylz on September 19, 2022, 07:16:47 PMLooks simple and nice and the modification makes it better. Your user base should not be limited to only btc users which is why I don't see anything wrong with alts inclusion.  As already pointed out above, searching with coin/token ticker doesn't bring the result except typed in full. Some of the alts don't show the right max supply as shown in the image below, checked 3 different alts that come out with different max supply from CG.FIXED.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: I hope you will make the site simple and not go into many more Altcoins, just like CMC.The only thing your site is missing from my point of view is focusing on Bitcoin charts instead of trying to add more altcoins.

comments.author: SFR10
comments.body: Quote from: agentF on September 18, 2022, 07:20:01 PMAs I'm running the project from my pocket and only spending and not making any money, I would need help from the community in bug searching and UI improvements.There's a bug that even if you choose the default coin [Bitcoin] "again" from the drop-down list, it prevents data from being fetched for "other currency pairs" on the list.- It's worth noting that isn't the case when I go back to pnnv.com URL, but as soon as I choose "any" cryptocurrency, it stops working (e.g. change USD to Euro).

comments.author: LoyceV
comments.body: Quote from: agentF on September 18, 2022, 07:20:01 PMI would need help from the community in bug searching and UI improvements.Okay, here it goes:1. On Tor Browser, it takes about 15 seconds to show the Bitcoin price in dollars after loading the page. Would it be possible to cache this server-side, so I'm not looking at "0 USD" while wondering why it isn't working?2. After changing to Obyte, it first shows the Bitcoin exchange rate for another 15 seconds, before updating it to the altcoin. Then, the Max Supply is stuck at Bitcoin's 21,000,000 instead of updating to Obyte's 1,000,000.

comments.author: Zwei
comments.created_time: September 22, 2022, 06:14:01 PMLast edit: September 22, 2022, 09:02:44 PM by Zwei
comments.body: It would be best to make this part interactive based on the selected coin
